text: Let's hope they don't convert any of *us* first.
speaker: Rarity

text: Welcome!
speaker: Mare 1

text: Welcome!
speaker: Mare 2

text: Welcome!
speaker: Stallion 1

text: Gosh, you really are the nicest ponies I've ever met.
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Come. All new friends stay with me until their cottage is completed. Let's get you settled, and then you can enjoy all that our little village has to offer.
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: [coughing] Brrrrrr! [sighs] Get the cutie marks back. That's all you've gotta do, Fluttershy. Just sneak through the dark up to that spooky old cave with the scary magical staff and get the cutie marks back.
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Okay, you're doing great. The cave's gotta be close now...
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Excellent work, Double Diamond.
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Of course, but I don't understand why you wanted me to bring them here. Fluttershy is one of us now. Surely she can be trusted.
speaker: Double Diamond

text: This one belongs to a princess. It could be very important to our cause.
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: But if Twilight Sparkle becomes our friend, then why do we care about this old cutie mark?
speaker: Double Diamond

text: I just want to keep them close until everything is... settled. You may go, Double Diamond.
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Oh, dear. How am I ever going to get the cutie marks back now?
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Ow!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Ugh! Starlight, you clumsy foal!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: [gasps] Oh, no...
speaker: Fluttershy

text: I've got a good feeling about today! So, do any of you have anything you'd like to say? Aw, pity. Well, let's try this again tomorrow, shall we? No new friends today, I'm afraid!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Wait! *I'd* like to lock them in.
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Marvelous, Fluttershy! That's the spirit! Party Favor, will you join us, please?
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: I'm sorry, Starlight! I'm sorry, everypony! I've seen the error of my ways! I never want to look at my cutie mark again!
speaker: Party Favor

text: It seems there's cause for celebration after all!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Hooray! [cheering]
speaker: Crowd

text: They tried to break me! They wouldn't stop talking about how different they are, and that somehow makes their friendship stronger!
speaker: Party Favor

text: Such backwards thinking.
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: But I didn't listen! I knew what they were up to, and I didn't listen!
speaker: Party Favor

text: Well done, Party Favor! We welcome you back with open hooves!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Um, Starlight? I think we might have one more friend joining us today.
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Is this true?
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: I-I think so. But I just want to be sure. If I agree to leave my cutie mark in the vault, I'll really be happier?
speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: Just look around! Equality has given us more happiness than you've ever known!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: And you wouldn't let me just live here in the village with my old cutie mark?
speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: Out of the question. A pony with a different cutie mark in our midst would destroy our entire philosophy. We are all equal here!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Then how do you explain *this*?!
speaker: Fluttershy

text: I *knew* you couldn't be trusted! No! Get away!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Wha... What are you looking at?! They're the problem, not me!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: How could you?
speaker: Party Favor

text: You said cutie marks were evil! You said special talents led to pain and heartache!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: They do! Don't you see?! Look at them!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Then why? Why did you take ours and not give up your own?
speaker: Sugar Belle

text: I... I had to, you fools! How could I collect your cutie marks without my magic?!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: But the staff has all the magic we need!
speaker: Night Glider

text: The staff is a piece of wood I found in the desert! It's *my* magic that makes all this possible! You'd all still be living your miserable lives thinking you're better than everypony else if it weren't for *my* magical abilities! *I* brought you friendship! *I* brought you equality! *I created harmony!*
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: You *lied* to us!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: So what? E-Everything else I said is true! The only way to be happy is if we're all equal!
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: Except for *you*.
speaker: Party Favor

text: Everypony has unique talents and gifts, and when we share them with each other, that's how rea—
speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: *QUIET!*
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: You can't have a cutie mark, Starlight! Either we're *all* equal, or *none* of us are!
speaker: Sugar Belle

text: Come on! Let's get our cutie marks back!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: Yeah! [shouted agreement]
speaker: Crowd

text: Come on! Let's go get *our* cutie marks!

text: Our cutie marks aren't in the vault! They're in there with her!
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Stand back, everypony!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: Even without my cutie mark, I can tell this is beautiful!

text: They think they can come to *my* village and disrupt *my* life? Let's see how they like spending the rest of their lives without their precious cutie marks!

text: Stand back, everypony!

text: They're gone! They were right over there!

text: Look!

text: She's headed for the pass! If she makes it into those mountains, we'll never find her!

text: These are amazing!

text: Then let's get moving, y'all!

text: Oh, *come on*!

text: Are you all so willing to give up everything because of these *strangers*?!

text: We gave up everything for *you*, because we thought you were our friend!
speaker: Sugar Belle

text: I can't believe we have to count on these other ponies to save *our* cutie marks!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: If we hadn't come here to help them, they'd still be living under her rules! Now it's their turn to help us!

text: And I know they can do it!
speaker: Fluttershy

text: My newest recipe – snow pie!
speaker: Sugar Belle

text: She's gonna get away!

text: Whoa! These are my old skis! This is where I first met Starlight!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: Maybe you can reminisce another time! She's almost to the caves!

text: Feel like an air drop?
speaker: Double Diamond

text: Yee-haw! Finally, I can buck like a five-bit snake herder in an Appleloosa ranch house again!
speaker: Applejack

text: And you got your countryisms back, too!
speaker: Fluttershy

text: Wh– I studied that spell for years! How can you—
speaker: Starlight Glimmer

text: I studied magic for years too! But what I didn't know then was that studying could only take me so far. Each of my friends has taught me something different about myself! It was their unique gifts and passions and personalities that helped bring out the magic inside of me! I never would have learned that I represent the element of magic without these five! And I certainly wouldn't be here to stop you now!
speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: Spare me your sentimental nonsense! I gave these ponies real friendships they never could've had otherwise!

text: How do you know that?! You never even gave us a chance!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: She's getting away!

text: We'll never find her in there!

text: We just have to hope that when she's had a chance to think it over, she realizes that you all *have* taught her something.

text: It's *you* who have taught *us* something. We all came to this village because we were searching for something missing from our lives. We thought Starlight had given it to us, but now... now it seems it was in front of us all along. It's us!

text: Does that mean you'll stay in the village?
speaker: Twilight Sparkle

text: It's our home. I'm not going *anywhere*.
speaker: Night Glider

text: This is a chance for all of us to get to know each other again for the very first time!
speaker: Double Diamond

text: And I finally have a chance to bake something besides terrible muffins!

text: Now *those* are real smiles.

text: I'll never get used to that.

text: I think it's divine.

text: Does that mean that the map is calling us somewhere else?

text: I have a feeling it means our work here is done.

text: Looks like you were right, Twilight. The map *did* have a reason for sendin' us here. We brought real friendship to these here ponies. Guess that's why you're the *Princess* of Friendship.

text: But the map didn't send *me*. It sent *us*. You're a part of me, all of you. And there's no doubt you're a part of my mission to spread friendship too.

text: Phew! Thanks for helping me get them so fresh and clean, Twilight.

text: Well... we're not really sure! But it involves a map and our cutie marks and a problem, and—
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Bored now!
speaker: Gilda

text: Well if you don't have a king, could you at least tell us where the Idol of Boreas is?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Ha-ha! Don't tell me you really *believe* in that thing.
speaker: Gilda

text: You'd better believe in it! [coughs and wheezes]
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: It was the best thing to ever happen to us griffons!
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: Oh, *great*. Now you got Grampa Gruff started!
speaker: Gilda

text: I'll tell you the whole tragic tale... [laughing] ...for a couple of bits.
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: The first griffon king, King Grover, united our kind like we've never been united before or since! And he did it all with that incredible Idol of Boreas.
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: That idol brought pride to the heart of every griffon that saw it! From one king to the next, Griffonstone had our golden idol. We were the envy of all other species. [narrating] It held us together – it gave us an identity – right up until the reign of King Guto.
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: [narrating] That's when Arimaspi came to steal our griffon treasure! King Guto tried to fight him off, but Arimaspi managed to get away with the idol!
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: [narrating] They say when our treasure fell into the Abysmal Abyss, our pride went with it. King Guto was the last king of Griffonstone, and we all lived miserably ever after. The end!
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: [tearing up] That was the saddest story ever!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Aw, well... *Tough tailfeathers! No refunds!*
speaker: Grampa Gruff

text: No wonder Twilight's book ended with the coronation of King Guto. Who would want to record a history that sad?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: It's not sad! Do we look sad to you?
speaker: Gilda

text: Pinkie, I think I know why the map sent us here. We need to find the Idol of Boreas and bring glory and pride back to Griffonstone!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Ha-ha. Here we go – typical pony hero complex. None of us care about that dumb old idol. Don't you get it? We don't care about anything, and *that's* the way we like it!
speaker: Gilda

text: I think Rainbow Dash is right! The map sent us here to fix some sort of problem!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: The only problem Griffonstone has *is you!*
speaker: Gilda

text: Well, I don't care what she says. We're gonna find that treasure, make Griffonstone cool again, and get back to Ponyville! Come on!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Wait, Rainbow Dash. What about Twilight's advice?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: What, taking a bunch of pictures?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: She mentioned finding answers at the library.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Knock yourself out. But when you get bored with Twilight's tour book, I'll be at the Abysmal Abyss finding the Idol of Boreas.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: I'm here to find your missing idol and save Griffonstone!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Uh, I'll need some rope, a grappling hook, and a guide to take me down to the Abysmal Abyss.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: And I'll need some bits.
speaker: Storekeeper

text: Hey, Gilda! Word on the street is that Griffonstone has an amazing library chock-full of answers!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Word on *what* street?
speaker: Gilda

text: Okay, maybe not *this* street, but on other streets, your library is the talk of the town.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: The library's right there, so why don't you go inside and leave me alone?!
speaker: Gilda

text: [gasps] Maybe it's good that Twilight didn't come... [to statue] It's sad what happened to your town, King, but Rainbow Dash can't be right. This can't all be because of a missing hunk of gold. [as King Grover] *You are right, Pinkie! And you've got amazing hair!* [normal] Aw, King Grover, you old charmer!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: [gasps] I know what Griffonstone needs!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Fewer ponies?
speaker: Gilda

text: A song! I've got a super song about smiling that sure to make even the most grumpy griffon grin! [inhales]
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Can't sing here!
speaker: Gilda

text: But how do you break into uplifting musical numbers with no singing?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Yeah, that's Griffonstone's biggest problem – lack of uplifting musical numbers.
speaker: Gilda

text: Well if I can't sing, how about a party? If there's one thing these griffons need, it's a good cheer! Where's your party store?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: No party store? Uh, how about cake? Nothing cheers folks up like cake! Where's a bakery?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Ugh.
speaker: Gilda

text: No *singing*, no *parties*, no *bakery*?! *What is this place?!*
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: You're welcome to leave [suddenly yelling] *at any time!*
speaker: Gilda

text: Well, that just takes the cake. Wait, no! It can't take the cake 'cause there is no cake! Or muffins! Or griffon scones!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Oh, we got griffon scones. That's my specialty.
speaker: Gilda

text: I'll buy one! [chomp]
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Bits first!
speaker: Gilda

text: Well?
speaker: Gilda

text: What, you like it? That's my Grampa Gruff's secret recipe.
speaker: Gilda

text: [with mouth full] Ow! I think I broke a tooth!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Well, whatever. No refunds. I don't even care anyway. I just want to sell enough of these so that I can leave this lousy town.
speaker: Gilda

text: [spits] I can help you with that!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Uh, you think you could tighten the strap on my helmet?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Can you give me more bits?
speaker: Storekeeper

text: [sighs] Never mind, I got it. So how deep is this abyss?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: How deep are your pockets?
speaker: Storekeeper

text: Don't you griffons ever talk about anything but bits?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Gimme some bits and I'll answer.
speaker: Storekeeper

text: No wonder Gilda's such a delight.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [chewing] Grampa Gruff's recipe is good, but it's missing one important ingredient.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Don't tell me. "Friendship"?
speaker: Gilda

text: Uh, no. Baking powder. Lucky for you, I never leave home without it! Now just pop those in the oven, and you'll have griffon scones worth their weight in gold!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Greta!
speaker: Gilda

text: Aha! I saw that, Gilda! You may act like a gruff, grumbling griffon, but inside you're gracious and great!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: What are you talking about?
speaker: Gilda

text: You just helped your friend up when she got knocked down.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: What, *her*? Greta's just some griffon I know. We don't have friends here! [sighs] I did have a friend once, but you saw how that turned out.
speaker: Gilda

text: [poink!] [slide whistle noise] Oh, my gosh, I gotta go find Rainbow Dash!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: See ya.
speaker: Gilda

text: [shouting] You sure we can't just fly down? Whoa! Never mind, totally got my answer there.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Just gotta find that golden idol and get out of this place.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [screaming] Whoooa!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Ow, ooh! My hoof! Help! Throw me another rope!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: You got bits?
speaker: Storekeeper

text: Wait! *Heeeeeelp...!* [fades into distance]
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [in distance] There you are! Forget about finding the idol! I figured out how to solve Griffonstone's *real* problem – scones!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Pinkie Pie, you get back here!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [in distance] Yeah?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: [in distance] Can you throw down a rope or something?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [in distance] Lemme look!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: One rope coming up!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: We need help. Don't go anywhere!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: [sighs] Where does she think I'm gonna go?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [panicked noises] I hope I don't go anywhere!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Rainbow Dash is stuck on a ledge in the Abysmal Abyss, and I need *your* help to save her!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Not my problem.
speaker: Gilda

text: Of course it's your problem! She's your friend!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Used to be.
speaker: Gilda

text: Can't you remember when she *was*?
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Yeah. Of course.
speaker: Gilda

text: Doesn't that griffon know she's supposed to *fly* at the Junior Speedsters *Flight* Camp?
speaker: Hoops

text: Maybe she just doesn't want to make you look bad! Hey there, I'm Rainbow Dash! And you are...?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Uh... G-G-G-G-Gilda.
speaker: Gilda

text: You sure about that? Stick with me, Gilda, and those guys won't give you any more guff. Whoa! You're awesome!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [laughing] You too, Rainbow Dash!
speaker: Gilda

text: Well, Gilda, let's show these guys how it's done!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: *Junior Speedsters are our lives,*
speaker: Gilda

text: *Skybound soars and daring dives,*
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: *Junior Speedsters, it's our quest to someday be the very best!*
speaker: Rainbow Dash
Gilda

text: Fine. I'll help her. But that doesn't make me her friend.
speaker: Gilda

text: Duly noted. [to the audience] Except it *does*!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Hang on, loser! I'm coming!
speaker: Gilda

text: What took you so long, doofus?!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Rainbow Dash! I'm coming for you!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Gotcha!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Hold on, you two! [grunting] Huh? [gasps]
speaker: Gilda

text: The Idol of Boreas! [grunting]
speaker: Gilda

text: I'm slipping!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: The idol!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: You're more important to me than some dumb chunk of gold.
speaker: Gilda

text: Hugging later, climbing *now*!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: I'm really sorry about how I treated you two.
speaker: Gilda

text: Thanks, Gilda.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Apology accepted.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: And I'm just sorry we didn't get your idol back. Now we'll never be able to solve Griffonstone's problem.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: That's what I was trying to tell you! The map didn't send us here to find the lost Idol of Boreas. It sent us here to replace it with something better!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Nothing's better than gold to a griffon.
speaker: Gilda

text: That's because you don't have friendship! If you can learn to care about each other again, Griffonstone could be a mightier kingdom than it ever was before! And you don't need some golden idol to do that. You just need each other.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Whoa, Pinkie. That was... really sappy.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Eh, what can I say? That's how I roll. Go on, Gilda! Go make a friend!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: I don't know, Pinkie. You really think these griffons are up for this? We aren't exactly in Ponyville, you know.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Okay, so she was really weirded out until I gave her the scone. Then she tried it and said it tasted good! That's the first nice thing anygriffon's ever said to me!
speaker: Gilda

text: Whoa, Pinkie. I guess that really was the problem we needed to solve.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [in film reel quality] Baking powder makes baked goods and friendships fluffy and delicious! [squee]
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Well, we'd better be heading home.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: What? Y-Y-You want me to spread friendship here by myself?! How am I supposed to do that?! I haven't even made one single friend yet!
speaker: Gilda

text: No, you haven't. You've made *two*.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [tearing up] Hugging! Hugging now!
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: But you'll come back and visit, right?
speaker: Gilda

text: Just try and stop us!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [to statue] See ya later, you old charmer.
speaker: Pinkie Pie

text: Uh, Pinkie? Who are you talking to?

text: Nopony! Come on, let's go home and see how Gummy did with Granny Pie's marjolaine recipe!

text: I'll never understand the ponies in this town! Everywhere I went, they were all gussied up and lookin' at me funny! Kept asking if I was "nervous"!
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Did they forget the wedding is *tomorrow*?
speaker: Matilda

text: Oh, maybe they're just as excited for us to be married as I am.
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Well, they're going to feel awfully silly when they realize they've got the wrong date. [gasps] The invitations are wrong! This says the wedding is *today*!
speaker: Matilda

text: But I got such a good deal on them...
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Everypony in town got these! The princesses have even RSVP'd!
speaker: Matilda

text: I told you we should have eloped!
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Oh, dear. The caterer, the flowers, the musicians! We've got to move it all to today!
speaker: Matilda

text: What?!
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Where's my wedding planner?!
speaker: Matilda

text: You told me you could do it for half what the others charged, and then you sent the invitations to everypony in town with the *wrong date*! [snorts]
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Muffin?
speaker: Derpy

text: I really messed up on those invitations! I feel just awful, Doc!
speaker: Derpy

text: Hmph! Perhaps that explains why I never got mine!
speaker: Savoir Fare

text: I told Cranky I could get 'em printed for cheap, but that meant hiring somepony with no experience using a printing press.
speaker: Derpy

text: Oh, I wish there was a way I could go back in time and fix all this.
speaker: Derpy

text: Going back in time is *old thinking*, my friend. I was working off a cutting-edge theory of making time come *forward* to you.
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: My life's work, decades – centuries, really – of research and experimentation, and I nearly had it cracked! Turns out there's a magic spell for it. Who knew?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: But there are so many things that magic can't explain, where science and mathematics are the *real* magic!
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Like these? They're pretty.
speaker: Derpy

text: Ah, yes, my flameless fireworks. I never could quite figure out how to get them to ignite.
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: How did you learn to make all this stuff anyway?
speaker: Derpy

text: I've been studying science my whole life. Ever since a particularly traumatic experience as a foal, I've been looking for ways to make sense of the world around me. Science provides explanations of things we never thought possible! Now, why did we come here again?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Yeah. Oh! Because I accidentally sent out invitations for Cranky and Matilda's wedding with today's date instead of tomorrow's!
speaker: Derpy

text: Great whickering stallions! I completely forgot! And I still need to get my suit tailored!
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Rarity? [knocking] Rarity! [grumbling]
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: [to DJ Pon-3] Please! You've got to help me! I lost track of time, unbelievably, and forgot that the wedding is this afternoon! [completely drowned out by hip-hop] Have you seen Rarity? She's got to alter the sleeves on my suit, and she's got to do it now! Oh, ha-ha, thank goodness. Lead on, my friend.
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Er, why have you brought me here? Rarity would never set hoof in—
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Great whickering stallions, they've got style! Gentlecolts! I'm facing certain calamity, and I couldn't help noticing your remarkable fashion sense. Could I have the name of your incredible tailor?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Oh, yeah, man. His name is me.
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: "Me". What an unfortunate name.
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: No, man, like, I manufacture all of my own garments. We all do, man.
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: Then you've got to help me! I need this suit tailored! It's an emergency!
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: [laughs] Sorry, man, we're just about to start the finals.
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: What's this word you keep using – "man"?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: I dunno, man, but guess what? Our fourth didn't show, so if you roll with us, we'll alter your suit for you.
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: I'm sorry, gentlecolts, but I will not bowl. The splits, the spares! There are simply too many variables!
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Variables? What are you talking about, man? Just throw the ball straight!
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: Hold on. Straight?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Very well. I'll try your "straight" technique. It just might be crazy enough to work.
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Do we know what they're on about?
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: The way they're huddled up like that, I'd say it's either a friendship problem or a monster attack.
speaker: Apple Bloom

text: A monster attack?! Blast! I'm performing at the ceremony this afternoon, and I still haven't sorted out what to play. How am I meant to practice with a monster invading Ponyville?
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: Maybe it's just a friendship problem, and it'll all be cleared up in half an hour or so.
speaker: Sweetie Belle

text: [groan] I hope so.
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: Where's Pinkie Pie?! *I need my wedding planner!*
speaker: Matilda

text: Oh, no! On my wedding day?! Somepony's gotta help me! You!
speaker: Matilda

text: Me?
speaker: Amethyst Star

text: I need to move an entire wedding from tomorrow to today!
speaker: Matilda

text: But nopony's asked me to organize anything since Twilight came to town.
speaker: Amethyst Star

text: So you'll do it?
speaker: Matilda

text: I used to be the best organizer in all of Ponyville. You bet I'll—
speaker: Amethyst Star

text: Whoa!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Come on! We better get to the salon before that monster flattens it!
speaker: Matilda

text: What am I gonna do? [gasp] Matilda! I feel so bad about the invitations! Is there anything I can do—
speaker: Derpy

text: FLOWERS!
speaker: Matilda

text: You want Matilda's arrangements... today?!
speaker: Lily Valley

text: This is awful!
speaker: Daisy

text: The horror, the horror!
speaker: Rose

text: So there's no way you can do it?
speaker: Derpy

text: We don't even have Matilda's flowers in yet, much less arranged! [gasps] This is a disaster!
speaker: Lily Valley

text: Okay. Thanks anyway.
speaker: Derpy

text: [gasps] Look, girls! A broken stem on one of the zinnias!
speaker: Lily Valley

text: Whaaat?!
speaker: Daisy

text: Oh, the horror, the horror!
speaker: Rose

text: I have to admit, when Matilda said we needed this place ready by today, I was a little nervous.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: With you by my side, I knew we'd get it done in time.
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: There is *nothing* like a best friend, is there?
speaker: Bon Bon

text: Anything's possible when you know somepony as well as we know each other!
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: What was that?
speaker: Bon Bon

text: There's some monster attacking Ponyville or something.
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: What is it this time? A creature from the Everfree Forest?
speaker: Bon Bon

text: Uh, I think it's some sort of *bugbear*. [giggles]
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: Did you say bugbear? It found me!
speaker: Bon Bon

text: What are you talking about, Bon Bon?
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: My name isn't Bon Bon. It's "Special Agent Sweetie Drops". I work for a super-secret anti-monster agency in Canterlot, or at least I did until the bugbear went missing from Tartarus a few years back.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: What are you talking about?
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: When it escaped, we had to shutter the whole agency. Every last shred of evidence of the organization's existence was destroyed. Celestia demanded complete deniability.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: ...What?
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: It was me who captured the bugbear. I had to go deep cover here in Ponyville and assume the name Bon Bon. I never thought it'd be able to track me, but now *it has*.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: Are you saying our whole friendship was based on a *lie*?!
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: I'm sorry, Lyra! I couldn't tell you for your own protection!
speaker: Bon Bon

text: B-b-but the lunches! The-the long talks! The benches we sat on! [tearing up] None of that was real?!
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: It was *all* real. You're my very best friend.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: I've got to go find a crowd to blend into before I put you in danger! I'll see you at the wedding.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: Fine! But we're going to talk about this later!
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: I need my ring today, no matter the cost! ...As long as it doesn't cost any extra.
speaker: Cranky Doodle Donkey

text: Seven/ten split, man. Harshest of the harsh. But if you pick this up, we win the whole shebang!
speaker: Jeff Letrotski

text: Doc! I've finally figured out how I can help! Your flameless fireworks look just like flowers! I'll use them for the wedding!
speaker: Derpy

text: Great whickering stallions! Wait!
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Wait! The flameless fireworks are *extremely* volatile! Without knowing what the trigger is, they could go off at any moment! My word, is that a bugbear?
speaker: Dr Hooves

text: Oh, there are so many things I'm forgetting! I hope Cranky remembers to tell the musicians! Oh! Oh! I'll never get my mane done in time!
speaker: Matilda

text: You must relax, my dear! We can handle *anything*! We once did a pony's hair *during* the ceremony!
speaker: Lotus Blossom

text: Oh, it's true, it's true! They really are the best! Matilda, I've just got to say, I already feel like we're family.
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: You do?
speaker: Matilda

text: Of course! I'm Steven Magnet, Cranky's best beast!
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: *You're* Steven Magnet?
speaker: Matilda

text: Well, what'd you expect, a bugbear? I've known Cranky for*ev-er*! Surely he must have told you about the time he saved me from Flash Freeze Lake?
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: *...You're* Steven Magnet.
speaker: Matilda

text: Oh, I know, I know! Typical Cranky, to leave out minor details, like the fact that I'm, y'know, a sea monster, right? [laughs] I just love that old burro!
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: I'm sorry, Steven. I guess I assumed you were a pony. And I had no idea you had such adventures together.
speaker: Matilda

text: Oh, honey, you don't know the half of it! But let me tell you something. In all that we've been through together, the only thing he ever cared about was finding you.
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: Really?
speaker: Matilda

text: Well, that and a baldness cure. [laughs]
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: He is the sweetest thing, isn't he? All the stress I've put myself through. All the stress I've put *him* through. The only thing that matters is that we're together. The wedding isn't the important thing – the *marriage* is.
speaker: Matilda

text: [laughing] Oh, goodness gracious. If you believe that, I have got a bridge to sell you! All these ponies traveling to Ponyville, putting on uncomfortable clothes, sitting through a long ceremony, you think any of them care about the *marriage*? [laughing] Honey, the wedding is *everything*.
speaker: Steven Magnet

text: [playing Mendelssohn's "Wedding March"] Ugh, all these wedding songs are so... standard. I want Matilda and Cranky's wedding to be special. [continues playing cello]
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: Thanks, but I'm not sure that's appropriate for a wedding, is it? [resumes playing]
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: [gasps] That's more like it!
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: Stop! I'm going to be late for the wedding!
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: [narrating] *What is life? Is it nothing more than the endless search for a cutie mark? And what is a cutie mark but a constant reminder that we're all only one bugbear attack away from oblivion? And what of the poor gator? Flank forever blank, destined to an existential swim down the river of life to... an unknowable destiny?* [licks]
speaker: Gummy

text: Something like that might work.
speaker: Octavia Melody

text: [hushed] What do you mean you left it on the counter?!
speaker: Princess Celestia

text: [hushed] I thought *you* were bringing it!
speaker: Princess Luna

text: [hushed] [groans] Well, this is just *wonderful*!
speaker: Princess Celestia

text: [hushed] *I* handled the gift for Cadance and Shining Armor! You were supposed to do this one, *remember*?
speaker: Princess Luna

text: [hushed] Well, we can't just come to this wedding *empty-hoofed*!
speaker: Princess Celestia

text: [sighs] It's alright. He always cries at weddings.
speaker: Princess Cadance

text: ...Usually it's not until the wedding *starts*.
speaker: Princess Cadance

text: These flameless fireworks look even better than flowers! [giggles]
speaker: Derpy

text: Attention, everypony! Our friends have done it! They've defeated the bugbear!
speaker: Bon Bon

text: [to Lyra] Hey.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: Hello.
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: So, uh, you didn't happen to mention our earlier conversation about my [hushed through gritted teeth] *secret identity* [normal] to anypony, did you?
speaker: Bon Bon

text: No. I did not. And you're not the only one with a *secret*, y'know. You know those expensive imported oats you were saving for a special occasion? I cooked them up and *ate* them! *All of them*! [laughs] It's sort of thrilling to reveal your deepest, darkest secrets!
speaker: Lyra Heartstrings

text: [laughs] That's what best friends are for.
speaker: Bon Bon

text: [hushed] Next time, you can just bring your *own* gift, and I'll bring *mine*.
speaker: Princess Celestia

text: But I also see so many ponies from all trots of life, brought together by love. Cranky searched all across this great land of ours to find Matilda, and no matter what obstacles kept them apart, love would finally bring them together, just as it has brought all of us together now. It's remarkable to me how a story like Cranky's search for Matilda could fill this room with such a unique collection of ponies! It makes you realize that everypony is the star of their own story. And it's not just the main characters in our stories that make life so rich! It's *everypony* – those who play big parts and those who play small. If it weren't for everypony in this room and many more who couldn't be here today, Cranky and Matilda's lives wouldn't be as full and vibrant as they are.

text: Uh...
speaker: Applejack

text: [disgruntled laugh] While I see your point, we should have discussed it *prior* to the grand opening, Sassy.

text: Wha... But... [stammering] Uh, n-no, Sassy. Promises were made, and I shall sew my very best to provide each and every pony a Princess Dress full of TLC.

text: Oh, thank you, Rarity, thank you!
speaker: Sassy Saddles

text: Oh, satin and silk, Rarity, are you sure you don't want your friends to help you make the dresses?

text: No, Sassy. These orders are my responsibility. All I have to do is stick to my plan so I can deliver each and every Princess Dress in keeping with my Rules of Rarity!

text:
The rules of Rarity, guaranteed quality
This I can assure
For each and every dress
I vow to give finesse
With time, love, and couture
speaker: Rarity

text:
My favorite moment's when a pony sees it
That special gown that she just adores
That pony's now in style
My hard work's all worthwhile
Oh, yes, it makes my heart
My heart just soar
speaker: Rarity

text:
The rules of Rarity, just a parody
No dress here's unique
The panels all the same
Each colored windowpane
I fashion only makes me want to shriek!
[sighs]

text:
Oh, to create would give me elation
To feel once again some inspiration
Come on now, Rarity
Give me some clarity
Time for your couture love to rule

The rules of Rarity, extra TLC
This feels more sublime

With a little extra shine

text:
The rules of Rarity, guaranteed quality
All can see it's true
These new gems add such flair

This old style suddenly gleams anew

The rules of Rarity

Now every dress I make

text: —ah, eh, never mind. Not helping.

text: Rainbow Dash, if you can prove that somepony else is behind Spitfire's disappearance before the start of the show, then you can still fly with us. In the meantime, Misty Fly, Blaze, head over to Stormy Flare's house and try to find Spitfire and bring her back. [to Rainbow Dash] I have to warn you, if you sent that letter, the bylaws are clear. I'd have no choice but to ban you from the Wonderbolts *forever*. Understand?

text: [sighs] I understand. But how am I gonna prove I didn't send a letter that I didn't send?

text: With me! Detective Rarity is on the case, and we are going to get to the bottom of this faster than my costume change!
speaker: Rarity

text: Yeah, what's with the getup?

text: *Obviously*, I am channeling Shadow Spade through these gorgeous garments, and she would say that the best way to prove that you didn't send the letter is to find out whoever did. First stop – the scene of the crime!
speaker: Rarity

text: [narrating] *We had a long road ahead of us, Rainbow Dash and I. Well, not too long because we didn't have much time, but the point is... I was up for the challenge.*
speaker: Rarity

text: [narrating] *There I was, surveying the crime scene, and looking* très chic *while doing it.* [normally] This must be the envelope for the letter Spitfire got! [sniffs] Hmm. These look like hairs from a rainbow mane!
speaker: Rarity

text: [gulps] That's not good.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [narrating] *Rainbow Dash was getting antsy, but I had faith I could clear her name and find the real culprit.*
speaker: Rarity

text: What are you doing?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: [stammers] Uh, just thinking thoughts. [narrating] *Rainbow Dash was right. In order to solve the mystery, we had to be focused. Driven. One hundred percent in the—* [normally] Ooh! The damask pattern on these curtains is exquisite! Oh, and this velvet rope-holder – oh, it's just—
speaker: Rarity

text: We don't have time to look at the décor! They're gonna kick me out of the Wonderbolts unless we solve this thing!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: I know, Rainbow, and I'm on this case like a charm on a bracelet! Here's what I'm thinking: somepony had to bring Spitfire that letter, which means *somepony* must have seen them!

text: I just have a few questions for you, and I'm sure once we get some things cleared up, we'll—

text: A likely story.

text: Except for you.

text: What are you tryin' to say?!

text: Just that there are only two rooms in the northwest wing: yours and Spitfire's. So the only other pony who had access to that wing was *you*.

text: [narrating] *The waters were getting choppy. Rainbow Dash's tactics were, well, horrid. It was time for another approach.* [normally] Perhaps *I* should take it from here! You castle guards have such a difficult job. I'm guessing that at times it can be rather... boring.

text: And of course being a castle guard can be thankless work. I'm not saying you did, but *if* you took a break, you *more* than deserved it.

text: Oh, you're right. We don't get a lot of recognition for what we do.

text: Was the frosting vanilla or chocolate?

text: Chocolate.

text: Was the base of the cake decorated with buttercream rosettes?
speaker: Rarity

text: It was.
speaker: Castle Guard 1

text: Ugh, *who cares* how it was decorated?!

text: Do you?

text: Oh, oh, oh. Did I say that one out loud?

text: I mean, even *I* think I'm guilty at this point! I really *did* want to fly in that show! What if I wrote that note when I was asleep?! Do you know what I do when I sleep?! Because I sure don't!

text: Well, kinda like *yours*.

text: No, you're not! Come on!

text: [narrating] *Rainbow Dash was obviously upset, but I had all my ducks in a row. Except one.*

text: [narrating] *She was not going to like it, but there was only one way to find out if my suspicions were correct.*
speaker: Rarity

text: We looked everywhere, but Spitfire wasn't at her mom's house!
speaker: Blaze

text: Where could she be?
speaker: Stormy Flare

text: I have found the culprit!
speaker: Rarity

text: Somepony sent Spitfire away and framed Rainbow Dash for it. And that pony was none other than... *Wind Rider*!
speaker: Rarity

text: Rarity, I can't believe you would accuse Wind Rider of framing me! He's a living legend, for pony's sake!

text: All the evidence points to *him*!

text: Peh! What evidence could you *possibly* have? All you did was ask about cake, admire décor, and change outfits a gazillion times!

text: Let me explain. I never believed you would send Spitfire away. When we found the rainbow hairs in Spitfire's room, I could tell they didn't fall out. They... were *cut*! Nopony loses hair in a chunk. And look at the ends. It's a straight line! They were clearly cut with shears, which means somepony planted it! Then when we were examining Spitfire's room, I smelled something on the envelope. *Juniper Phoenix*, Wind Rider's cologne of choice! Then, in the castle hallway, I noticed some of the damask curtains fell out of their velvet rope-holder, indicating that somepony had been hiding behind them! Perhaps *after* they dropped off the fake letter?
speaker: Rarity

text: *Juniper Phoenix* is a very popular fragrance, and anypony could have moved those curtains.
speaker: Wind Rider

text: Precisely why I questioned the castle guards! They were at their post at the entrance to the hallway all night, except for a small window of time when somepony brought them cake. A cake that was ordered by a girl pony with a raspy voice! Whoever ordered the cake got a chocolate stain on her ivory scarf, and I couldn't help but notice that Wind Rider's scarf is tied in a tight Windsor knot instead of its usual loose slipknot! And why is that? Is it to hide *the chocolate stain*?!
speaker: Rarity

text: Ah, this is preposterous. Wonderbolts, you don't believe a word of this, right?
speaker: Wind Rider

text: Just admit it – you're as guilty of framing Rainbow Dash as you are of ruining that ivory scarf!
speaker: Rarity

text: Ah, fine! You caught me! I did it!
speaker: Wind Rider

text: But *why*, Wind Rider?! Was it because I took the last broccoli at the dinner and you really, *really* wanted it?
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: No. It was because he was afraid that you would break his long-distance Wonderbolt record! I heard him when Spitfire said you were close to breaking his record. He said, and I quote, 'Heh-heh'. That's the polite but disingenuous laugh you make when you want to seem happy but really you're not.
speaker: Rarity

text: I thought if I could get Rainbow Dash kicked out of the Wonderbolts forever, my record could be preserved.
speaker: Wind Rider

text: Really? That is *so* not cool. And I thought you were the coolest Wonderbolt *ever*. Until now.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: I did what I had to do to protect my record! Sometimes you gotta play dirty to be the best!
speaker: Wind Rider

text: That's not what being a Wonderbolt is all about.
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: She's right! Wonderbolts look out for each other! Which reminds me, where *is* Spitfire?

text: I sent her the letter pretending to be Stormy Flare. I told her I had Pegasitis, and the only cure is the ice iris in the Crystal Mountains.
speaker: Wind Rider

text: No wonder she's been gone so long. Ice irises are almost impossible to find in spring!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: The Crystal Mountains are too far for anypony to make it there and back before the royal garden opening! Rainbow Dash, we need you to fly in Spitfire's place!

text: But Spitfire shouldn't have to miss this! I'm gonna get her!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: But you'll never make it in time!
speaker: Soarin

text: Then there's no time to lose!
speaker: Rainbow Dash

text: Rainbow Dash is still gone!

text: Spitfire, you're back! I can't believe you made it!

text: Rare, I couldn't have done it without you. And I'm sorry I doubted you. But why didn't you tell me what you were doing?

text: Well, I didn't want to get your hopes up until I was sure, and I couldn't be sure until I saw that chocolate stain.

text: [sighs] I'll get my chance one day.

speaker: Rarity

text: It's such an exciting city, and there's still so much I'd like to do there. So many museums and historical landmarks to visit. Not to mention all the libraries! But this is *your* mission. Heh-heh. Don't worry about me. I've got plenty of... books... to keep me... busy.

text: Mm-hmm.
speaker: Rarity
Applejack

We can't possibly approach every single pony in town until we find out what we're meant to d—ooh! [reading] "Please help us restore our long-lost but beloved tradition, the Midsummer Theater Revival. There's a guest performance by a local theater troupe, the Method Mares, as well as games, food, and much, much more. This event promises to bring our Bronclyn neighbors together and restore our sense of community, but there's so much to do and we need your help." Huh. [gasps] Darling, this is it! text: But when she moved away to be closer to her grandfillies, the neighborhood lost the special tradition she had started, and worse, the sense of community it fostered.

It's hopeless... Just hopeless!

text: [clears throat] Thank you all so much for coming. The Midsummer Theater Revival was always something that meant so much to me, and it seems it means quite a lot to all of you as well. I really can't take all the credit, though. My dear friends Rarity and Applejack helped me ever so much.

text: Oh, darling, please, it was just a few costumes.

text: Yee-hoo!

text: I can speak from my own experience that the power of Cutie Mark Magic is very real, and in the instance of my friends and I, it can be traced to a single event! Without Rainbow Dash's race to defend Fluttershy's honor, this rainboom wouldn't have happened. Fluttershy might never have discovered her love of animals. Applejack might never have realized that she belonged on her farm. And Pinkie Pie might never have decided to leave hers. It must be hard to imagine Rarity without her sense of fabulousness. But it's even harder to fathom what *my* life would be like. Without this rainboom, I might not have gotten into magic school.
